name: Supreme Commander: Forged Alliance
description: The last days of man are at hand.. Two years after the Infinite War the once great warring nations now lie in ruins, and humanity’s hope for a brighter future is nothing but a bitter memory. A new, seemingly unstoppable enemy, supported by the zealots of The Order, now seeks to eradicate mankind: UEF, Aeon Loyalist, and Cybran alike.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP Service Pack 2, Windows® Vista Processor: 1.8 GHz processor  Memory: 512 MB RAM Hard Disk Space: 8GB available hard drive space Video Card: 128 MB video RAM or greater, with DirectX 9 Vertex Shader / Pixel Shader 2.0 support (ATI 9600+, Nvidia 6200+)
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows® XP Service Pack 2, Windows® Vista Processor: 3.0 GHz Intel or equivalent AMD processor or better Memory: 1 GB RAM or better Hard Disk Space: 8GB available hard drive space Video Card: 256 MB video RAM, with DirectX 9 Vertex Shader / Pixel Shader 2.0 support (Nvidia 6800 or better)

reviews.review_text: This is hands down the best RTS ever made. Pros:  - 1000s of units  - Simulated projectiles can hit other things. (I've seen an anti-air turret shoot down a nuke)  - Bubble shields  - MASSIVE experimental units  - Explosions  - Massive scale, the battleships feel impressive next to the smaller T1 units  - Scaling economy, you don't 'buy' units like in SCII or a lot of other RTS games, you build them, draining your resources over the course of their construction time  - 1000s of units  Cons:  - The unit movement is a bit weird sometimes  - If you're reading this review you probably don't own the game yet, luckily this con is easily fixable
better then supreme commander 2. 10/10
One of the if not last good RTS games. Alot of different things to do to win and such a well solid game. The expansion's campagin is quite hard to boot.

TL: DR- 10/10, literally one of the three best strategy games i've ever played, and probably the best RTS.  This game can have a steep learning curve, and campaign missions may well take you two hours to complete if you go carefully, or twice that if you go full defensive on the hardest difficulty setting, but this just means that there's actually meaning to good base design, and it is incredibly satisfying to build up an impenetrable fortress then create an army that will flatten your opponent... hopefully. Then there's also the option of building so many nuclear launch facilities that you can overwhelm your enemy's missile defense systems and drown them in nuclear fire (for reference, nukes in this game are just about the hardest to obtain in any game i've found, but they're also the most visually spectacular and you actually have cause to fear them)  There is a good variety of options for the skirmish mode, you can put yourself in a cagefight with a trio of AI opponents that cheat just for added difficulty, you can customise some major gamemode settings such as completely disallowing certain units or tech-levels, or you can increase the rate at which everyone gathers resources to speed the game up a bit.  The graphics are very nice, especially considering the number if units you will have running around the map at any given time. the textures don't look that great if you were to zoom all the way in, but if you do that you'll zoom out again to find that OH GOD THE CYBRAN HAD A BUNCH OF STEALTHED MONKEYLORDS OUTSIDE MY BASE AND THEY'RE TRAMPLING MY REACTORS!  However, the place this game really outshines anything else i've played is its interface. you can customise so easily what the map shows you in terms of the range of your anti-air, anti ground, indirect fire, etc, your sonar, radar, omnisensor ranges... it offers you so much information but if you're finding it overwhelming you can just switch it all of with about two clicks. Unit control is so good in this game, in terms of automation. you can very reasonably set up a factory to produce infinite of a set of units, have air transports pick them up from your base, and airdrop into a different part of the map with no input from the player. this makes managing hundreds (or, with mods, thousands) of units so much eaiser, leaving you to direct your army, navy and airforce, and watch the explosions.
Probally the BEST real time strategy game I've ever played. I definately recommend this game to anyone.
Without a doubt.  One of the greatest RTS games ever made.

Hands down my favorite RTS by far. Playerbase remains active (mostly on FAF, but Steam has a bit of activity as well) and is generally friendly and helpful. Learning curve is a bit steep, but then again, the learning curve for a good RTS SHOULD be steep. Highly recommended to any fan of the genre.

This review contains: 'English/Portuguese'  English:  This game is the nearest game to 'Total Annihilation' (one of the best RTS of all time), you can find (maybe 'Planetary Annihilation' but it hasn't been released yet), so, trust me, if you want a massive scale RTS game, you WILL love this game, and really, people will trow rocks at me, but this game is far superior then 'popular' games like Starcraft and C&C (i have both)...  Portuguese:  Este é o game que mais se aproxima de 'Total Annihilation' (um dos melhores RTS de todos os tempos), que você pode encontrar (talvez 'Planetary Annihilation' mas este ainda não foi lançado), então, confie em mim, se você quer um jogo de RTS de escala massiva, você VAI amar este jogo, e realmente, pessoas vão tacar pedras em mim, mas este jogo é muito superior que jogos 'populares' como Starcraft e C&C (eu tenho ambos)...

All I have to say is, I love Scholastic book orders! (That is where I saw the game for the first time in 4th grade) Probably 100 hours on this game prior to getting it for steam. Is it my favorite game of all time? YES! Not just if your an RTS fan, If you like video games, GET THIS GAME! I can't say anything bad about this game except not enough people play it anymore!  EDIT: If you want to play this game online, look into a program called forged alliance forever. It's a large growing community of sup com players, full of mods and other cool game modes. Just check it out, ton of fun.

The best thing since sliced bread.   Also has a lovely community at FAF (Forged Alliance Forever). They have tweaked gameplay that improves upon the perfection that this is. There's a rating system, they hold tournaments, made new maps and I've met some very friendly people over there. Buy it and get the glory of FAF too.  Come and play if you like massive armies, giant walking robots of doom, nukes and factions that exist just to knock seven bells out of each other.
You can blow a load of ♥♥♥♥ up from miles away.

Freaking Amazing game. The new one(SC2) is complete crap, but this one is amazing. You can have up 1000 units per 8 teams, fighting some massive war. Huge number of units possible to build on each team. You can also mod it, so its 3x better at any time. The missions are great too, fun, not slow, and forces you to adapt.  The greatest experience in an RTS you will ever have.
I still play this game after so manny years its still my favorite.  I play on FAF and my god i still have so much fun. Truly epic i scale and counters a true master piece 10/10 !!!

-Joins friends game -Builds a ♥♥♥♥ base -Had good alliances -Break an alliance -Get bombed multiple times -Still alive -Player bombs team-mate -Avenge team-mate -Head over to the enemy territory  -Enemy rage quits after we all became an alliance to over run the enemy -Profit

Most of the community features are now gone with the shutdown of GPGnet, but this game is still one of the best RTS games ever made. I think the matchmaking is all gone, but I never play public games, anyway. As long as I can invite my friends into a game, I'm happy.

A must have for anyone interesting in a Real time strategy game, new or experienced. Supreme Commander: Forged Alliance is probably the shinest gem out there that still blows all the other next generation RTS games by this day.   It has nearly everything that an RTS must have, the necessities and unique features, such as faction diversity, adjacency bonuses, and mod support as well. It may seem complicated at first, but you get used to it pretty fast, as it is easy to learn.  The community is still alive and working here, usually hanging on the Forged Alliance Forever lobby mod, which optimizes the game further and adds working multiplayer lobbies, ranked matchmaking, and so forth.  Each unit from each faction serves a vital role in your great conquest across the the entire battlefield, lots of diversity into them as well.  Resources is a pretty interesting one, unique but sometimes frustrating if you don't know your build orders.  I highly recommend this game.
The best RTS of all-time. I poured hours into this game when I was little and can say that it still holds up even now. Screw Clash of Clans and play a real game.

Supreme Commander is quite possibly one of the best RTS games ever done. It's massive, it's versatile, it's full of straregy. There is no other equivalent mind blowing experience when hundreds and hundreds, maybe thousands ground, air and naval units clash on the battlefield.  It's supreme.  This game should be in every real RTS gamer's bookshelf or Steam library, assuming the hardware requirements don't blow up your computer.
A most amazing RTS game which is brilliant to play with friends. Nothing quite like blowing your mates up with a tactical missile whilst laughing maniacly over the microphone.

I'm not very fond of strategy games, and to be perfectly honest I don't really like the vanilla experience of this game either. However if you download some custom survival maps, this game becomes very fun. I love the survival mode maps. Even if you're not a fan of strategy games I highly suggest picking this game up if you happen to see it on sale at some point.
Best multiplayer realtime strategy game ever made.

One of the best RTS games ever made. I love this game so much (though, I suck ♥♥♥ at it). I highly recommend this game if you're into large scale battles, or just a fan of the RTS genre in general. 9/10
I never thought I'd find killing my friend so fun until I launched that strategic missile at my teammate.

So basically if you your a fan of RTS's then this is a must play game, it's the greatest RTS to date that i've played. It has the massive maps for those who need space for there armies and small maps for those who fear large maps. If's perfectly balanced, easy to play but hard as nails to master. I highly recomend getting FAF (Forged Alliance Forever) a small little application that allows for you to play with real people on rank, unrank, team games if you purchase this game. Just buy this game I promise you that this is without of doubt the half life 2 of RTS's.  10 rainbow unicrons out of 5 rainbow unicorns.
this is a great game
You don't need any other strategy game.

This game is the standalone expansion of the original supreme commander. nevertheless it plays the same, and we wouldn't have it any other way. In supreme commander you don't just fight a battle, you create an entire war zone. Supreme commander focuses on ALL aspects of war; naval, air, land, radar, transports, defense turrets, resource production and managment, adaptation, vetranacity, nukes, nuke submarines (ftw), even shields and anti nukes not to mention the experimental units (extreme game changers). This game takes strategy to a whole new level with different factions and different units. The game itself wven gives you a menu to mod it, and the mods for this game are outstanding. But this is definatley a game for more experienced players, for those who are new or just getting into these games i would suggest supreme commander 2. the second game is...simpler...its known as a shadow of its former self but the gameplay is easier to understand and control but all the while ruining the game with the experimental factories.

over 4k hours outside of steam. Best rts ever, i can't like any other rts because simply to put it, they are not as large scale. You can send an army to a enemy base or send over a colossus sized tank, spider, spinning saucer, and more to completly crush the enemy. every second is super important. When your commander sets down for example, and if you don't focus on building an army and sending it before you can be hit, your score on the top right of your screen will show you are lower than most others. The game is just. beautiful to put it. And there are 4 factions, the aeon, the uef, the cybran, and the seraphim. Each with a unique build design and a unique way to play. Cybran get a experimental spider named Monkeylord which deals 2k damage per second, and the average comm has 12k. The uef for example get a tank called a fatboy. Its a mobile base which has powerful main cannons, which deal 200 damage a shot. Weak anti air, 2 repair pads for air forces, and can build units. Please consider buying this game, check out forged alliance forever and on youtube check out gyle. The community is as activeas can be since this game origionally came out in 2007. There are also huge mods avalible to download from moddb and such to add even more, but be careful please. Every mod you activate in the lobby, builds up ram. The program can only hold 2 gigs and with certain programs can use about 2.3gigs of ram. (Large Adress Aware for me) but please keep this game going.

It's funny. I never thought there would be a time that I would play an RTS with a friend, a close friend, mind you, and think to myself, 'Hmm. I should probably build multiple bases so that he doesn't crash a CZAR over my Commander, knowing fully well that we're on the same team.'  I love this game.
It's ok I guess... I just played a little tho
Good game, huge armies and each mission in the campaign is enjoyable and long.
if you want to have fun in a good rts game play this

The best RTS game there ever was and ever will be! Enormous amount of content, extremely deep and pure skill: no luck, no button-smashing, no chances and no RNG! I dont even like the genre (because i suck at playing in real-time), but i love to watch other people play, it really is that good!  (Im using the FAF client to play, btw, so my playtime on steam is obviously non-existent ^^ )
yo this game is pretty cool but watch out for optimus prime
Want perforated eardrums? Zoom out. 10/10 can't hear again
One of the best RTS's of all time. If you like RTS, you must have this.
This is our hour! Fantastic RTS gameplay for you inner strategy needs! All for £9.99p (Copyright Peggy)

In my opinion, this is hands down the best RTS game out there. Don't bother with SupCom2, it's just a dumbed-down version of this game with slightly improved AI.  Honestly, I cannot recommend this game enough. If you're even remotely into RTS games you need to try this one. You should pick up both SupCom and SupCom FA if you're into the story mode, however if you're only interested in multi-player and skirmishes, just stick with this one.

I really like this game. Although it has a pretty steep learning curve, once you get the hang of it, you can't get enough of it. The official servers are down however, but there is a community based lobby that you can use to play. This lobby is called Forged Alliance Forever, and it adds a whole bunch of features that are not in the main game.

My very first game of SupCom:  1. Figures out how to build, because tutorials are for losers 2. Builds Mass Extractor in the middle of nowhere 3. Builds Factory 4. Epic battle music plays as I churn out tons of robots 5. I select all my robots and look for the enemy attackers 6. All I see is an enemy scout attacking my isolated mass extractor 7. RAAAAAAAAAAAAAGE  Best Communist Russia/China vs 'Murica Tactical Nuke Simulator 9/11 -IGN
One of the best RTS games i have played in years! I truly recommend it!
By far the best RTS I've ever played. Don't let my low play time fool you, I got a few thousand hours in before I started using Steam.

Great game.  + fun to play  + nice graphics  + LAN/online play  + nice controls, easy zooming  in and out and other things   for planning ahead.   - takes a while to learn.  - Game can become really slow when building late tech units and buildings  - campain isn't great, not much of a story

One of the best real time strategy games out there. With huge maps and a wide varierty of units, you will find yourself coming back to SUPCOM very often. Great game to play with friends, and check out Forged Alliance Forever for mod support.
Check out Forged Alliance Forever which is an awesome community driven MP lobby/ladder system.  One of the best RTS of all time.
Check out Forged Alliance Forever which is an awesome community driven MP lobby/ladder system.  One of the best RTS of all time.

Best strategy game ever made. When I first played Supreme Commander, I fell in love with strategy games. Once I heard that they made a second and a third one, I had to jump on this. My only wish for this game is that they update it. I also need a better processor than Pentium.

The BEST rts game i have ever played!!!!  When someone brags about a new rts and how they attaked an enemy with a large army of 50 ground units, HA, little do they know in this game that is classed as a scouting party i have attacked some one with 250 units before oh and that wasnt just with ground this was 250 of each ground, air, and sea, with a few huge experamental units in the mix alond side a lazer satelite to make sure.   As well as this i nuked him at the same time as the godly asault on his base to truely make sure he wouldnt suvive, and all this happened in a tiny bit of the map when fully zoomed out, not like other games where your head is trapped at a sertian height and u can only see a bit of the map at a time. This feature is in plase not for the fun of it but because the map is huge and i could of had that battle 100 times in different locations at the same time and still the map wouldnt be full.  10/10 would unleash godly army and own again
The best RTS on the market if you think RTS's should be about relying on your brain and your ingenuity, and not fingers and spreadsheets

Still a great RTS game with nice sci-fi elements.  Graphics could be considered dated, but eh. Instead of getting epic graphics, you get a great RTS large scale to play with. Thousands of units per player, can go up if you change the limit up to 5000 units per player. This can make everything slow down a lot, but on the flipside you get to watch thousands of units (air/land/sea) fight it out in slow motion. Zoom in at one section, zoom out to watch the whole thing.
Man this one is better than SC2 to be honest ^.^  10/10 For Awesome Strategy Game
This was the last GOOD RTS released, in 2007. It's been all level grinding RPG ickiness since then.
2nd best RTS of all time. 2nd only to C&C Generals Zero Hour. 4/5*
Pretty much Supreme Commander: More Potatos.

This game is just amazing, at first it was hard but when you succeed and see the enemy blow up into a nuke the satisfaction is like no other- incredible. highly recommend the game, dont get supcom 2 or supcom without forged alliance it's not worth it but with the forged alliance it's one of the best games i had the pleasure to play. 10/10

Good game, I recommend this over any of the other Supreme Commander games. There's so much content, way more strategies you can use because of this. More maps, buildings, units etc. make this game a must buy for any RTS fan.  The price might seem a bit much for something as old as this, but there's just so much stuff it's justified, but you could wait for a sale if you're not sure ;)
fun and all but i would really like it to go on sale so i can buy a copy for a friend

Love This game went againts 8 people and nuked all but one, later he made it rain nukes it does hurt when you get hit by 25 nukes at once :(  9.9/10 the 0.1 is the fact their is no epic victory music so i have to improvise using rick roll
Pretty hard to get the hang of, but rly good game.
Simply the best RTS game since 2007,
This game is your classic RTS which introduces super weapons for epic battles between humans or AI opponents. If you decide to play against the AI, make sure you download the Sorian AI pack.
one of the best strategy games ever
most amazing game of all time
Yes, yes and yes!

This is one of the games that built the entire strategy era. Using the resource system from total annihilation and huge 3d maps you can battle enemies like there's no tomorrow. Send in hundreds of bots and experimental creations to annihilate your foes, or just drop a nuke and watch the world burn.  Exellent for co-op with friends or AI's for those who want to play alone.  Pro: Huge battles, challenging but rewarding  Con: a bit demanding for such an old game, large battles can eat a chunk out of your pc

So...While this game is older, I have to say it's still one of the best RTS games on the market and well worth every penny of it's listed price, and more. It even out-shines its successor in game-play. Yes, this game has a somewhat steep learning curve, but that's what's beautiful about it, It keeps you finding new ways to adapt. And to date, this is still the only RTS I have found where you can steel one of every faction's builder units or buildings and create the ultimate army consisting of every faction's units. This game is golden, Get it.

I thought the online community of this game was dead, but to my delight it is still very much alive with the Forged Alliance Forever community driven app thing. Very fun game, my favorite rts of all time. Learning curve isn't super steep, it's fun to play. The online community still has plenty of players in each skill bracket to pick up games in the 1v1 ladder. If you want some heart pounding 1v1 or some 4v4 setons don't hesitate to check out the app. I hadn't played since around 2010, so I was scared at first lol, but don't be shy try out the game if you enjoyed it in the past. If you're new and thinking about it, try it, trust me. Fast paced rts with so many ways to win, just using your brain in this game is enough to get you the win sometimes. 4 amazing factions, very well balanced...
HAY, IM THE GUY WHO DOES PROPAGANDA FOR STEAM, BUY THIS GAME!!!!!!!!
Old but gold!!

(disclaimer, i am writing this abit fast for the steam nomination, whilte correct it is shorter and less in detail than that i would like)  this game is one of my all time favorites, trough many lan parties and hours played it has earned the right to be my top rts game. the economics are a thinking mans game with things costing over its building time instead of instantly, meaning you could start build things that you could not afford at the moment, it also ment that you could tank your economics if you were not carefull.  the scale of battles are amazing and the seamless zoom is the best. you can use the second screen as a map or zoom in on a spot were you need it. 4 diffrent races with diffrent approaches massive units that towers over starter units.   it is strange, this game came out late 2007. and in almost 10 years there has never been another game (please correct me if i am wrong here) that has used two monitors better than this. it is a disgrace! but it just shows how much thought has gone into this game.

AHH!!!!!! BEST GAME EVER!!!! Full of explosion (Micheal Bay), excitment, strategy and teamwork. You got 4Fractions. Got the UEF, Cybran Aeon, and Serephim. Each fraction specialize in different areas. If its ground, navel or air. Thats your job to find out what each does. This is my top most FAVOURITE game!! I recommand this game 1000%!!   Land: You got you T1 units. Light tanks, light artillery, anti air and scout. Basic units with light armour light damge. Good units to harras someone with in the early game;) You then have your T2 units. Meduim tanks/Walkers, missle launchers, shields and stealth troops. Great Units to over take a bunch of T1 and destroy base. You got you T3 Units. Heavy tanks, mortor units and some ant air as well. Amzing troops for taking out just about anything. Even experimentals:0 You then got you experimentals. Got you Monkey Lord which is in the second picture, your Fat Boy which is also in the second picture in the back and much more ranging to air and artillery. Some dangerous and far range and some at close range. Dont want to get near these guy.  Air: You got your T1 units. Interceptors, bombers, light gunships, scouts and transports. Great units to take control of the sky, for the beggining of course. Got your T2 units. Gunships, fighter/bomber, suicides and transports. Great units to deny any ground attack coming your way. You have your T3 units. Heavy gunships, Heavy bombers that are super deadly, and your fighter. Greaet troops to secure your air control and MURDER and enemy base. Then you got your Experimentals. Deadly from the sky but has weak armour. One run from the Serephim bomber and your a goner. Got your saucers and your heavy, HEAVY gunship.  Navel: You got your T1 Units. Frigates, Submarines, and anti air. Great units to take conrtol of the water and Tech up. You got Your T2. Got your Destroyers, Cruisers and submarines. Great units to bombared the land from the water at a great distance. Use these units to support you ground and navel You have your deadly T3 units. Battleships, cruisers and submarines with NUKES!!!!!!!! Then got experimentals. got your omega submarine too your floating fortress!!  And of course you got your engineers.   Structures: Over 50 structures!!!! 50!!! Got you energy, mass, air and ground defences, artilerry, wall sections, troperdo defence, radar, land/air/navel factory and so much more. Even experimental structures.   Resources:  Now this is all cool but you cant just build them right away. Whats the fun in that. You got your 2 resources that are the most important thing in the game beside your commander. Let me repeat that, you got your 2 resources that are the most important thing in the game beside your commander!! You have your mass and energy. More you got, the faster you can build and tech up for better troops and structures. If you are low, might want to fix that because your enemy will take advantage of that.  Commander:  Most important thing in the game. Your commander(Which is you) dies, its game over. Commander has several upgrades. Each fraction has different upgrades on there Com. Gun upgrade, Tech upgrade to stealth. Much that you wil have to find out for your self.  Well I think Iv'e said WAY too much already. Got carried away by how AMAZING this game is. Now it might say only 23 hours but Iv'e played over 500+ hours on my other account!! Also including all the hours I have played in FAF (Forged Alliance Forever). Come check out the website and download it. Thousands of people playing right now!! This is by far my most favourite game!! Join us!! Cmon. I know you want too:)  111/10
WOW SO DEEP SO EPIC games nowdays are so dumbed down. This is the real deal and one of the best RTS i've ever played. Shame it took me 8 years to find it

This game would have been the wet dream of Churchill, Ceasar Dwight. D. Eisenhower or anyone else who has to command in times of war.  Because you can do EVERYTHING you want in a massive scale.   If its transporting hundreds of Bombers/Gunships via a submersible Submarine, start a nuke from another submarine, annihilate your enemy with satellite-mounted-lasers or just bombarding your enemy back into the stone ages by using long-range artillery installations.   Altough the game is old, you can still find a lot of guys to play with via Forgeed Alliance Forever, with a very vivid community.   Only disadvantage is the high strain on your CPU and for beginners the tough opponents in multiplayer.

Overwhelmingly amazing game. This was one of my first RTS games, and one of the best choices I have ever made. I would have payed twice the price had I known how good my Forged Alliance experience would be.
one of the BEST RTS games ever, its a shame this game isnt played more.

I love this game even before i bought, out of the whole supreme commander series this to me is the best one. even with it not  Having the best graphics  it can lag with out the installation of Cpu Maximiser. etc..  but even with these downside the game play is excellent your always on your feet even aganist the ai's, i would recomand it to any friend who loves strategy games.   must buy if u love games of this genre :)

This game would have been the wet dream of Churchill, Ceasar Dwight. D. Eisenhower or anyone else who has to command in times of war.  Because you can do EVERYTHING you want in a massive scale.   If its transporting hundreds of Bombers/Gunships via a submersible Submarine, start a nuke from another submarine, annihilate your enemy with satellite-mounted-lasers or just bombarding your enemy back into the stone ages by using long-range artillery installations.   Altough the game is old, you can still find a lot of guys to play with via Forgeed Alliance Forever, with a very vivid community.   Only disadvantage is the high strain on your CPU and for beginners the tough opponents in multiplayer.

The greatest RTS of all time. Period.   Pros:  + Unit chain-pathing from a source building to create patrols. Good players might not use this as much, but crappy players like me will no doubt LOVE the visual affect of watching the patrols running.  + 3 levels of technology for all units in a logarithmic expense. I.e. it will take forever to get to the next tech if you try to jump too early, so the time building up creates a layering of the playing field.  + The single-player campaign is nice. If you are interested in this, get the package that has FA and the orgiinal game to get the whole campaign.  + The campaign is the only place you'll hear voice acting. All the sounds in a skirmish are just robotic machine noises and they are all nice to listen to. The play field becomes this noisy droning clattering thing.  + This was the first game to have the feature 'zoom in wherever my mouse is pointing'.  + Templates are cool!   Cons:  - The UI seems old(ish) compared to recent games. So don't make comparisons!
One of the best RTSs of all time. So much fun with my friends with long games, full of nukes and artillary. 10/10, would dropship invasion again.
I haven't played much but it seems okay.

This game is amongst the best strategy games that has ever been made. It has tons of content, a good campaign and its easy to learn. There is one single design problem though that puts me off. There are ram limitations in the game engine which means that if you play with 4 ai bots or more your game will slow down to slow motion in late game. This happens because the engine cant use all the memory of your computer.  The game is still worth a shot though as it is a unique strategic experience that you wont find in mosto ther strategy games. I personally love it even though it has ram limitations. Good graphics, fantastic gameplay, good unit variation, every faction is different gameplay wise and the music is fine. I rate this game 8/10 but from a neutral perspective I would rate it 6/10 not because the game is bad but because of the ram problems.
Good game  Play it.

Probably the best RTS I've ever played, completely outshines both Sup Com 1 & 2 due to the perfect balance of economics and strategy. The first game was good, lacking in some areas (economy), but those issues were well adressed in this expansion. Sup Com 2 completely dumbed down EVERYTHING to do with economy, shifting the focus away from being a tactical smartass to being someone that wins by producing the most units in a given time. The campaign is very fun to play, especially co-op done through FAF, which is supported by Steam. All around great game for strategy enthusiasts, I highly recommend it.

an rts on a massive scale. entire armies made within minutes, devestating experimental units to command, new structures, and the favorable strategic nuke for anyone who has a good graphics card and loves to have a nice strategy game, try this one out

I really like this game. It is the best RTS game I have ever seen. Fun campaign. The graphics are not bad at all. Just don't jump right into a skirmish. Take the tutorial because it helps a lot. It is also a good sandbox game. Anyway, get it!
The greatest RTS in History! Played all of them including Supreme Commander,This game,And the Supreme Commander 2...  And i will tell you... you will not find a better RTS then this game...
10/10  One of the best strategy games i ever played.

Way back when, I chose the dawn of war games over SupCom. Those DoW games got me into the corresponding tabletop hobby, and I couldnt be happier with the people I've met and all the friends I've made from just buying one little game.  A couple days ago, I spotted this on steam and decided to give it a try, see what I would have gotten had I chose this game instead.  Before I go on, let me explain that I have always loved RTS games. DoW, AoE, Stronghold, C&C, etc. So when I saw this game and the massively positive reviews for it, I bought it straight away! It looked awesome, whole armies crushing your enemies underfoot, whats not to like?  The game worked for me, only one crash while I was in the tutorial. So no problem there.  The problem was, well, the mechanics. I am used to a minimap, when I play againest my competitive friends, the minimap is needed for survival. The tutorial pointed out pretty quick that my screen IS my minimap. Great.  Not only did I keep forgetting about it, its also extremely awkward to use. I kept playing without using it, making it seem to me that I was alone, when in fact there was a huge battle going on around me, and I couldnt see it.  Secondly, there is a STEEP learning curve. The Controls take way too long to learn and master. I consider myself atleast competent when it comes to RTS's, I can normally figure out the controls in a game or two.   With this game? Well, you may notice that I only have TWO hours played on it, and also that I've returned it.   Well, thats because these games take HOURS to play. You can't bang out one game in a hour. Heck no. You have to be willing to SIT THERE and WAIT. Wait for your eco to boost up, wait for your buildings to build, wait for your units to be created.   Each unit has around a 7-10 second timer. Even the weak units. Yes it has a HUGE pop cap of up to 1000, which is awesome. But for one thing.  I can't get any resources. The game wont give you ANYTHING starting out, and resources come in at a TRICKLE. For my first skirmish game after the tutorial, I tried setting it on huge resources or whatever, and it does not have any. You are stuck with the regular resources, which let me tell you, are gone faster then ice placed in the middle of the sahara desert.   I had to use CHEATS. CHEATS. To explore the mechanics of the game more fully.   I am not one of those people who can sit down for 4-5 hours on ONE game. This game is for you if you like slow paced afternoon-length games. If you cant invest the time and effort it takes to play this game, dont buy it.    I spent two hours with this game. Only played ONE game. And I couldnt even finish it because it got boring using the cheats since it took to long trying to play the game with normal resources and setup.   Poor economy, poor unit build time, confusing map interface, extremely long length game battles without the resources to easily get said long games off the ground effectively, this is a MASSIVE dissapointment to me.   Buy if your a HARDCORE RTS player who can spend hours in ONE GAME.   If you like RTS' but dont want to invest hours in a single match, or are new to the genre on a whole, or just a casual gamer, SKIP.    When I think of the people who might like this game, I think of a old man in his mid 70s. It requires ALOT of patience. Kudos to anyone who can sit through it, I sure as h*ll cant.   Its like you build a beautiful mansion, but then don't install plumbing or power, and only use one room out of the whole mansion.   Dissapointed, gave it a chance, glad I chose DoW. Skip if you like anything thats not snail-paced.

This is a NOT a terrific game. It's similar to the EA C&C games...i.e., a lot of strategy IS involved. It game forces you to make decisions in battle with your enemy. you think! That is, if you want to win the various battles that you will become involved with. The odds of you going forward beyound the Normal mode is impossible. The programmers of this game are completetly out of touch of reality. Don't play this game...it will only disappoint you. I am very disappointed in the Supreme Commander's seriest. This game is impossible to win. The odds are against you. I suggest that you don't even attempt to play this game. The other two Supreme Commander games are great......this one is the worst possible game to play. Save you money...

If you missed Gas Powered Games' Supreme Commander when it released in February, the new expansion offers quite a few changes. We were big fans of the game when it first came out, but there's no doubt it was one of the most complex, time-consuming RTSes in quite a while, and had an unapologetically steep learning curve. Many lamented that the three factions in the original, the Cybran, Aeon, and UEF, looked and behaved too similarly. And on the surface they do resemble each other, but after hours of playtime, you learn to appreciate the differences and understand how to capitalize and manipulate them to your advantage.  GPG seems to have two main goals with the standalone Forged Alliance expansion: faster action and more diversity. Diversity is inserted primarily with the addition of a fourth faction, the more visually distinct Seraphim. Though they, like the other three, possess similar lower tier units, higher tiers possess more individuality, particularly those of the experimental variety. Accessing these differences between factions, meaning teching up to tier three (T3), requires a different kind of resource production strategy since GPG moved mass fabricators from tier one (T1) to tier two (T2). You have to be much more aware of your extractors this time around, making sure to expand your base of operations across the map until you can start churning out T3 fabricators and power plants, since extractors seem to play a much more vital role in maintaining reasonable resource rates in the early game.
One of the best RTS games of all time. If you like command and conquer you will like this game just as much.

Probably the best Real-Time Strategy games I've ever played, and while I won't pretend to have an exhaustive knowledge of the genre, SupCom: FA is an excellent game. The factions are diverse, the unit variety is substantial, the maps are immense, the controls are surprisignly intuitive once you get the basics, and the Experimental tier units are great fun. The campaign is a solid challenge and you start out with most of the available units ready to use, instead of slowly unlocking them as you progress. The base skirmish AI is pretty weak unfortunately, but there are some great mods available, or convince your friends to get it and play against them! All in all, I would highly reccomend this game.

This is still my favourite RTS game, and its been out since Nov 2007 can you believe! Nothing else comes close it terms of scale, variety of strategies and pure awesomeness (including Planetary Annihilation). When it was released this needed a very high end computer to play nicely, but today the game will look great on most gaming computers. Single player is fun, but multiplayer is where it comes alive. The vanilla version of Supreme Commander was the first game to give you Strategic Zoom (which lets you zoom from a high level view of the entire map right down to individual units with the flick of the mouse wheel) and has a massive variety of units and strategies. You might base your strategy on overwheliming the enemy with low level units, or alternatively sit back and build your economy so you can afford a devestating experimental unit. And of course there's always the nuclear option.  While the basic game works fine and there is a multiplayer lobby inegrated with steam for the steam version you really want to download Forged Alliance Forever. This is a community built multiplayer lobby, which has matchmaking, map and replay vaults, popular mods etc, and has helped massively extend the life of the game.  Nuclear launch detected...
One of the best RTS iv'e played! Much better than SC2!

I had been playing this (vanilla at first) from the day it came out (2006 ish), until GPGnet closed. Put a good amount of time into it. It ranks as my favourite RTS after Total Annihilation. SupCom was considered the spiritual successor to TA. Massive unit counts, experimental units dozens of stories high, nukes, cross map artillery, the strategies are endless. Any mistake could cost you the game.   Forged Alliance Forever (look it up and download it) has now given new life to this game, with about 5-600 active users. It has ranked ladder, co-op campaign, mods, mp skirmish, and much more. It is easily usable with your steam version of the game.

The greatest strategy game I have ever played. Too bad I didn't discover it until 2015. :(  If you like RTS games like Starcraft, Age of Empires or Rise of Nations, this is along those lines, but with some huge differences that make it unique and absolutely PHENOMENAL. The economy and production is different and takes some getting used to, but adds much more depth and strategy than you get with other games (even though there are only 2 resources!). It's not all about micro and having a zillion APM like Starcraft, but micro still matters and can mean the difference in a match. Cool units, well balanced.  The campaign is no better or worse than you'd get in other games, but I have always preferred skirmish matches in any game.   You may find the AI is stupid (isn't it in basically all games?) or too difficult, or that there is no acceptable medium between the hard and cheating AI. You should go to forged alliance forever  (faforever.com , download the lobby) for the multiplayer, maps, mods and improvements, which help fix this and give you exactly the challenge you want and tons of other cool stuff. (I regret not doing this sooner!)  Why has does no other strategy game let you so easily zoom out exactly as far as you want?!!!! I never realized how awesome this feature is until I played this game. I can no longer be satisfied playing other games because you can't do this.   Forged Alliance was revolutionary. Even with outdated graphics, I love this game. I haven't played Supreme Commander 2 because based on reviews it went more towards the typical, above mentioned RTS games, and the differences between them and Forged Alliance are what make this game BETTER. It is addicting. You will not regret the $15.   (Also, watch Gyle casts on youtube for entertaining replays of games and to learn tips and tricks to improve your game.)

Forged Alliance is different from all the other RTS'. The ability to build massive bases and have hundreds of different units and or experimentals on the map really does seperate it from the competition and make it stand out among the RTS franchise. If you are hesitating on getting this because Supreme Commander 2 seems much more new, please dont get SC2.   Forged Alliance in many SC fans opinion is considered better than the SC2 due to many things such as tech tiers, the resource system (You put money into something as you build it, just like if you built half a skyscraper instead of a full skyscaper, you wouldnt have spent that much. This makes the economic system on FA unique) and much more robust experimentals. I love this game, and if you pick it up make sure to look up Forged Alliance Forever. Its a free multiplayer lobby with many built in mods (if you want to use a mod) fixes, etc, etc. Most of the community is there now. See ya!.

It's been many years since I've played Forged Alliance. I recently came back to it and found the mechanics still hold up after all these years. Tremendously fun with a 'flow' based economy, this is a good choice for people who don't want the intense APM challenge that games like Starcraft demand.  The game can take a lot more time, with multi-hour games not uncommon, but when playing with friends, this is a blast! Naval maps are my personal favorite, as some of them cover 81x81 km!  8 years later, I'm still playing it. Buy it, especially if it's on sale.

Probably one of the best, if not THE best RTS game out there. If you've only played Supreme Commander 2 you have no idea how diluted that game is compared to this. The last TRUE Supreme Commander. Nukes in Supreme Commander 2 are small, and can barley destroy a base. Nukes in Supreme Commander Forged Alliance can destroy half the map, and take multiple players with it. Supreme Commander 2 has wimpy expirementals that can be defeated by 20 or so upraded tanks, in Supreme Commander Forged Alliance you'd be lucky if an army of T3 tanks could stop a galactic colossus. Not to mention the Seraphim special unit that is literally a bomber dropping tactical nukes wherever it pleases. Maps on Supreme Commander 2 are small in comparison to the massive 81 kilometer giants in Forged Alliance that take you minutes to fly a ship across. I think you get my point. If you want the anadulterated Supreme Commander experience, buy this game. It is, in my opion, one of the all time great RTS games, and nothing has touched it's massive scale of destruction, yet...

Supreme Commander: Forged Alliance, likely one of the best purchases I've ever made on Steam, literally. I have nearly 500 in game hours banked into this game and I tell all my gaming friends to try it out. It may not be the most complex or wide scale strategy game out there, but it offers players a fast paced, visually pleasing display of massive battles and base building. It takes a little while to adjust to the drain based resource system. If you're not careful, you can wind up zeroing out on both resource types and your war efforts drop to a crawl and you quickly become cannon fodder.  The one thing I absolutely love about this game is the custimization for gameplay. There is no set difficulty, you can pick and choose what kinds of AI you want to play against, whether it be turtles, air, ground, or navy based, or perhaps you prefer a rush style of play, where everyone is hurtling hundreds of puny tanks at each other until someone drops in a massive experimental to slaughter one side or the other. Either way, its the players choice. I also love how easily the game can be modded, I'm not saying its Minecraft where there are thousands of mods out there, but for anyone looking to expand the chaos and scale of the game, drop by the Total Mayhem page on ModdB or perhaps go for the Black Ops mod set.  Don't let the age of this game fool you, it may be a few years old, but even the best PC's will eventually lag while trying to handle this game. And yeah, I know, that doesn't sound great, and its not, and it can be annoying, but it gives you a sense of just how massive the game can be.

Epic large scale battles with hundreds of units, an excellent community driven multiplayer client with all kinds of balance patches called Forged Alliance Forever, a decent selection of interesting mods, and epic experimental units! What's not to love? The only bad part is poor AI all around (Which can get annoying).
an Epic and Awesome game, with ( even still ) extensive online community ( check out Forged Alliance Forever )

Absolutely fantastic game! Couldn't believe Total Annihilation had a successor and by god was it a good one! If you were a fan of TA then this is a must have, don't be fooled by the flashier looks of Supreme Commander 2 as this game is far superior. Ok the campaign isn't the greatest (I do like to play the campaigns in games) but that is only a minor, minor setback for such an awesome game, I still believe this is better than even Planetary Annihilation and definetely one of the best RTS games you are likely to come accross. Buy this game. Immediately.
The learning curve is quite high but once ya learn it you never forget it its EPIC!
很难找到这么好的游戏，请珍惜！ It’s Difficult to find such a good game, please cherish!

Well balanced factions... Zero flaws... Huge war machines... Massive scaled battlefields... Macro as well as micro... Many playable maps... Custom mod support... From tiny war tanks to massive experimentals, From nuclear warheads to satellites, From submarine-aircraft carriers to massive UFO's... This game is a masterpiece and it's the only RTS game that has such quallity.
Hands down best RTS ever made. even has duel monitor support!
I spent over two hours crossing a river on normal difficulty. My troops got pushed back. The rest of my playtime is regained my foothold.

This is one of the best RTS games as of 2015. When it launched it was an incredible resource hog as it suggested 2 monitors and required a great deal more processing power than most people had. It is a beautiful game overall and the balance is quite good. The ability to make massive super weapons is a real joy because they are quite powerful but they take a long time to build and can be a gamble if the enemy blows them up before they are finished.  This game is oldschool in the sense that it doesn't have cheating AI that always knows exactly what you're doing. It will build the tech 3 radar that has a massive detection range... but that's a structure you can build as well. (you can always blow it up or take out his power to turn it off).   This game has a slight degree of technicality with your base setup (the wiki can explain it very quickly with a picture). Long story short you can put power plants next to factories and each will reduce the cost of things you build in the factories. The other game resource, mass, will also reduce building costs if you build a factory on top of a mass extractor (often called a mex). The danger with this is that a tight network of touching/linked buildings is more effecient but it is much easier to destroy because power plants are volitile,  The bad news is that the AI can't really compete very well on water maps. The AI is also somewhat weak to turtle strategies involving large defensive structure batteries. However one of the interesting aspects of this game is that you kinda need to learn which thing to build to counter what your opponent is building. Did I mention that anything you send at the enemy's base that gets destroyed can have the mass reclaimed by the enemy?  One more bit of bad news is that I don't think a lot of people play so you'll probably be playing against the AI. That being said the AI is a good opponent. There is a built in 'cheater' option if you want to play against a crazy tough AI opponent who will always be 1-2 steps ahead of you.   This is a really good game and the first time you see a nuclear missile hit the enemy base you will really be in for a treat. If you hear the words strategic launch detected and don't have countermeasures built you'll be in trouble.  This is one of those games you can play for hundreds of hours and never feel like you're still playing to get your money's worth.

>Play Supremacy >Destroy enemies >1 engineer hiding in the middle of the ocean on an 81x81km map  10/10 if the police put as much effort into searching as my submarines they would've found Madeline McCann

Game is great if you like large scale RTS games. Forged alliance is better then the original Supreme Commander, with the extra faction, and Forged Alliance has alot less bugs.

This game gave me lots of fun, and I recommend to everyone. I always played this on LAN and it was amazing to send a nuke to your enemies base and see them facepalming across the table!
With some of the largest scale i've seen done in a RTS, this is, and will stay, my 1# favorite RTS game.

Forged Alliance is a stand-alone expansion to the first Supreme Commander, and is basically 100% better than Supreme Commander - to the point where you really should only buy Forged Alliance.  I have a few gripes with this game - the four races are a little too samey for my taste, and your units still do that stupid thing where a perfect square formation given a move command will slowly stretch out into a vulnerable line as it moves - but overall, it's a very enjoyable RTS for those willing to invest some time into learning its mechanics.

I got this game just a few weeks ago and I already have 50+ hours. This RTS is very challanging, but very much worth the money. Also, I love Dr. Brackman's voice, oooh yesss... Very strange yet formal.  As of now my rating would be about 7-8/10.
This is a game that takes practice to master, although the grind is worth it if you like seeing things other than your ACU (Armored Command Unit) explode.

Pretty much the ultimate RTS still. There's no RTS game better before or after this. The only downside is the slightly complex economy, but once you figure that out there is an amazing amount of different strategies to play. To every move there is always a counter, so it's always fun to try different ways to win. The game let's you play at the strategic level with lots of building and unit tasks able to be queued. The zoom out to strategic level is fantastic. Most of all the big units are just fun to use.
Great Game.

Don't be fooled by my hours, I just bought this game for myself for Christmas, but I have accumultaed a safe to say 1,000 hours usin gan old disk copy. Buying it again was worth it. If you're looking for RTS, get this game. If you're not into RTS, get this game because it'll get you into RTS. I'm pretty sure actual reviews aren't really something worth reading since no review can really live up to the glory of describing what this game details, so instead I'll leave some advice form what I've learned after years upon years of playing. Don't train in skirmish for mulitplayer. In skirmish, your battle will feel like the way a war should be, with factories cranking out weapons and armies for you to lead to anihilate your opponent. You will lead your armies and crush enemy bases ending everything with a bang as you finally crush their commander. Multiplayer can only best be described through the question of, 'What would have happened if the Cold War went hot?' Nuclear warfare on a grand scale and combat revolving around reconassaince and survival wages on in the lobbies. That is, atleast when I used to play. Nowadays, you're better off relying on the third-party program that I won't bame unless asked because it's name has been uttered endlessly in the reviews you've already read.
Still a solid game after all these years; with diversity and scale that really blows you away.

Seriously, still one of the best, if not THE best real time strategy game I've played. Perfect for LAN-parties where you just wanna nuke your buddy.  In Supreme Commander, nukes aren't tiny. A well placed nuke can wipe out an entire player.  Also, the largest units are so big that the literally crush and kill smaller unites that happen to be in front of their tracks/under their feet.
The RTS which does not age even after so many years. Now maintained by the community  (faforever.com) . For an RTS fan is a must! ;-)
very fun game i love it probably one of the best rts game ever

Easily my favorite RTS.  I would also like to point out that this game has a dedicated group of fans that formed Forged Alliance Forever (FAF). FAF offers servers for online gameplay as well as updates and balance patches. They also have several different game modes and a cooperative campaign. Although the game is a bit dated, the game's community is still very much active and would love new players.
Haven't had this much fun since I played Total Annihilation and the Red Alert games as a kid. And Z! (that game is on steam!!)

The. Best. RTS. Ever. Period. Give it time and try to understand the economy. Then you'll see. Trust me.  E: I started to play this game when it came available and didnt have it on steam so thats why the low playtime. Im really counting over hundreds of hours.  Get this game and FaForever.

This is still one of the deepest RTS games out there, and it's been out for almost a decade. I'd highly recommend it.  (One thing to note - you'll want to download the Forged Alliance Forever client to actually play it once you've bought a copy, since this adds a lot of further patches for multiplayer etc that aren't in the base game, as well as improved AI.)
To this day no game as managed to surpass this gem in terms of scale and pure awesomeness! Nothing beats carpet bombing my enemys base with nukes.

Dusted this game off for a few skimishes over the last few months. What a classic.   Unique game mechanics set this game apart from others in the RTS genre:  - Mass and Energy economy is infinite, multiple tiers  - Large scale - 81x81km maps - Decent selection of units and big unit cap limits - Nukes are awesome - Great Coop play  I would recommend this game to anyone. Still holds up graphics wise but this franchise needs to reboot as a modern Total Annihilation.
A truly awesome game.
